raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you today?
User: What's laser tag?
System: Like paintball, but with lasers!
User: lol good description
System: Do you know what paintball is?
User: yeah I played it before
System: Cool! What did you think?
User: It's somewhat exciting, but very tiring :)
System: That is very true. What is your favorite color?
User: I like red

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how is your day?
User: It's good. It's raining a bit, but I am enjoying a good book. How about you?
System: It's good, I just got back from walking my dog What book did you read?
User: I'm reading the Three Body Problem. Ever heard of it?
System: No, what is it about?
User: It's a sci-fi book about aliens and a type of virtual reality. Pique your interest at all?
System: Slightly, I typically read fiction but I can curious what type of virtual reality is discussed in the book
User: Cool. This virtual reality is a based on life on an alien planet. There is a twist though. Do you want me to spoil it for you?
System: Yes!
User: The virtual reality is actually based on a real alien civilization! And that civilization is coming to attack earth! dun dun dun dunnnnnnn

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hello!
User: any improvements in your marathon time?
System: No, only a few minutes. I still find it difficult to run long races
User: I see. Are you planning to do any sporting events in the coming months?
System: I think a triathalon would be cool

System: I haven't heard of a Spartan race before, what does it involve?
User: It has abt 20 obstacles like crossing high walls, monkey bars, etc. Its fun

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey, whats up?
User: I was not able to attend the lectures last week. Can you help me understand some concepts?
System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?
System: I'm afraid not, right now I'm in a meeting and I'll be going for lunch afterwards. How about tomorrow at noon?
User: No problem! Sure. We still have plenty of time for the test. Anyways, how's your preparation going?
System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: You must be new around here!
System: Not really. I am REDACTED_TERM years old.
User: Oh, I meant this neighborhood, not the planet earth! haha
System: I hate one word answers. It's ok. I understood you anyway. Why are you laughing?
User: I didn't give a one word answer!
System: That was a bit mean of you.
User: What was?
System: That thing we mentioned earlier.
User: Which thing?
System: The first one, I think.
User: Can you quote it? I don't know what you are referring to...
System: Only at formal occasions. I was referring to what you just said.
User: Okay. I am kind of lost to be honest.
System: Oh. I appreciate honesty. What is it that confuses you?
User: You don't seem to be making any sense.

User: Yours is the opinion I want

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! How's it going?
User: Hi, how are you?
System: I'm doing well, thank you. How are you?
User: I'm fine. What's up?
System: Not much. How about you?
User: nothing new. Anything exciting happening recently?
System: Not really. You?
User: I watched a movie recently which was pretty good
System: That's good. What movie?
User: the irishman, have you seen it?
System: I have not. Should I?
User: I think so
System: Alright, I'll put it on my watch list.
User: How about you? Have you watched anything interesting recently?
System: I've been waiting to see the new Star Trek movie.
User: what is it about?
System: The adventures of Kirk, Spock, and McCoy.
User: when was it released?
System: It just came out today.
User: are you sure, I think it's been out for a while
System: I'm positive. I know because I just watched it.
User: well, the fact you just watched it doesn't mean it was released today
System: That's what I said, I did watch it today.
User: ok, I'll put it on my watchlist
System: Let me know what you think of it when you watch it.
User: sure, I need to go, nice talking to you

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hello there, nice seeing you
User: Likewise.... wanted to know if you and the kids would want to join us for Disneyland trip around Christmas?
System: oh wow, that sounds like so much fun! definitely count us in. what is your plan?
User: Tentative plan is to drive to LA on 23rd and then stay at the Disney resort for 2 nights. I heard Christmas eve they have loads of fun events.
System: awesome, I think I won't tell my kids and surprise them last second. How bad do you think the traffic is going to be?
User: Great idea! I will probably do the same. Surprise surprise.... Traffic might be a little harsh.
System: Yeah... thats a shame but nothing we can do about it. What do you plan to do about dinner the 24th? Do the rooms in the resort have kitchens?
User: Good point. I am not sure about that. Let me inquire about that. If not, then we can look for an Airbnb closeby. Does that work?
System: Yeah, I think so. It might be a tough decision though, if we want to have a nice dinner then we have to leave the parks early to start cooking. Another option is to have dinner at a restaurant.
User: but I would think everything is closed on christmas eve
System: Thats true. Hotels with restaurants sometimes offer dinners for christmas and new year's eve. We should call and ask about it.
User: Sure, I can take a lead on that. What are you getting for your REDACTED_TERM year old this time?
System: I was thinking on getting a large set of standard legos. What will you get for yours?
User: Likewise. My son is crazy about legos.

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: going slow.... looking forward to the weekend
System: Me too! What are you planning?
User: still thinking. Any recommendations on things to do in Bay Area?
System: Are you a foodie?
User: may be
System: What's your favorite type of food?
User: Mediterranean, but I would rather try something new
System: Go to the Turkish restaurant by the Safeway in Berkeley. It's amazing!
User: any places for day trip that you could recommend?
System: Where are you coming from? San Francisco itself?
User: south bay

Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.
